title: Starch's Lemonade Stand
content:
[[include :scp-wiki:theme:flopstyle-dark peenumbra=a]]

[[module CSS]]
 :root{
     --header-title: "STARCH TUBER";
     --header-subtitle: "(the jar contains lemonade i swear)";
}

 .report-box{
   /* -- Report Box -- */
     color: hsl(37, 100%, 5%);
     background: var(--fgColor);
     border-top: 7px solid var(--accentColor);
}
 
 .red-tint, .orange-tint, .yellow-tint,
 .green-tint, .cyan-tint,
 .blue-tint, .magenta-tint, .grey-tint{
     color: hsl(37, 100%, 5%);
     background: var(--fgColor);
     border: medium solid var(--accentColor);
     font-size: 1.35rem;
}

.yellow-tint, .yellow-tint hr, .yellow-tint h3{
   --fgColor: hsl(60, 77%, 82%, 1);
   --accentColor: hsl(37, 100%, 26%, 1);
   --accentColorLite: hsla(360, 62%, 85%, .5);

}

[[/module]]

[[module rate]]

[[div class="blockquote classic"]]
Hello there! I am Starch Tuber, also known as French Fries. I am a batonnet or allumette-cut of deep-fried potatoes of disputed origin from Belgium and France. I am prepared by cutting potatoes into even strips, drying them, and frying them, usually in a deep fryer. Pre-cut, blanched, and frozen russet potatoes are widely used, and sometimes baked in a regular or convection oven; air fryers are small convection ovens marketed for frying potatoes.

I also wrote some stuff I guess. Just look below!
[[/div]]
